BiblioData.Title: UV-CURING PROTECTIVE COAT FOR THERMOPLASTIC SUBSTRATES
BiblioData.Abstract: The present invention relates to a multi-layer product, the first layer being a UV-cured protective layer which contains SiO2 nanoparticles, and the second layer containing a thermoplastic substrate. In addition, the invention relates to the composition of the UV-curable first layer, a process for the production of the multi-layer products and products, such as e.g. glazing products, which contain the named multi-layer products.

Claims.P: What is claimed is:
1. A multi-layer product comprising a first layer (S1) and a second layer (S2), the first layer being prepared from
A) one or more aliphatic polymer precursors selected from the group consisting of
A.1) aliphatic oligomers containing urethane bonds or ester bonds with at least two acrylate functions per molecule or mixtures of corresponding oligomers and
A.2) aliphatic reactive diluents with at least two acrylate groups per molecule or mixtures of corresponding reactive diluents,
B) one or more fine-particle inorganic compounds,
C) at least one organic UV absorber selected from the group consisting of triazine derivatives and biphenyltriazine derivatives,
D) optionally one or more radical scavengers of the hindered amine light stabilizer (HALS) class
E) optionally one or more flow control agents
F) optionally one or more solvents, and
G) at least one special photoinitiator selected from the group consisting of acylphosphine oxide derivatives and [alpha]-aminoalkylphenone derivatives,
wherein the second layer comprises a thermoplastic polymer.
2. A multi-layer product according to claim 1, wherein:
a) based on the amount of components A and B:
to 95 wt. % component A,
5 to 80 wt. % component B and
0.1 to 10 wt. % component G are used, with the total weight % of component A and component B being 100%,
b) an amount of component F is used such that a solids content of 20 to 50 wt. % for the mixture of components A, B and F results, and
c) based on the weight of solids in the mixture of components A, B and F:
0.1 to 20 wt. % component C,
0 to 10 wt. % component D and
0 to 5 wt. % component E are used.

3. A multi-layer product according to claim 1, wherein the aliphatic reactive diluent (component A.2) is selected from the group consisting of 1,6-hexanediol diacrylate, tricyclodecane dimethanol diacrylate, trimethylol propane triacrylate, pentaerythritol tetraacrylate and the methacrylate derivatives thereof.
4. A multi-layer product according to claim 1, wherein component B is silicon dioxide with a mean particle size (d50) of 1 to 200 nm.
5. A multi-layer product according to claim 4, wherein the silicon dioxide has a particle size distribution with a ((d90-d10)/d50) of the distribution of less than or equal to 2.
6. A multi-layer product according to claim 1, wherein component C is a compound according to the following formula (IV)
EMI16.0
wherein
X-OR<6> , OCH2CH2OR<6> , OCH2CH(OH)CH2OR<6 > or OCH(R<7> )COOR<8 >
R<6> =branched or unbranched C1-C13 alkyl, C2-C20 alkenyl, C6-C12 aryl or -CO-C1-C18 alkyl
R<7> -H or branched or unbranched C1-C8 alkyl, and
R<8> -C1-C12 alkyl, C2-C12 alkenyl or C5-C6 cycloalkyl.
7. Multi-layer product according to one of claims 1 to 6, wherein component D is one or more compounds of the following formula (V)
EMI17.0
wherein
Y-H; R<6 > or OR<6 >
R<6 > branched or unbranched C1-C13 alkyl, C2-C20 alkenyl, C6-C12 aryl or -CO-C1-C18 alkyl, and
R<9> =Z-R<10> -Z-R<11> ,
EMI18.0
wherein
Z=a divalent functional group such as C(O)O, NH or NHCO
R<10> =a divalent organic radical such as (CH2)1 with 1=0 to 12, C-CH-Ph-OCH3
EMI19.0
R<11> -H or C1-C20 alkyl.

8. A multi-layer product according to claim 7, wherein component D is selected from the group consisting of bis(1-octyloxy-2,2,6,6-tetramethyl-4-piperidyl) sebacic acid ester, (3,5-di-tert.-butyl-4-hydroxy-benzyl)-butyl malonic acid-bis-(1,2,2,6,6-pentamethyl-4-piperidyl) ester and mixtures thereof.
9. A multi-layer product according to claim 1, wherein component F is one or more compounds selected from the group consisting of alkanes, alcohols, esters and ketones.

10. A multi-layer product according to claim 1, wherein component G is one or more compounds selected from the group consisting of compounds of formula VI (acylphosphine oxide) and formula VIII ([alpha]-aminoalkylphenone),
EMI20.0
wherein
R<12> -C1-C30 alkyl, C5 to C6 cycloalkyl optionally substituted by C1 to C4 alkyl, and/or chlorine, bromine, C6 to C20 aryl, C6 to C20 aryloxy or C7 to C12 aralkyl

R<13> -C1-C30 alkyl, C1-C30 alkoxy, C5 to C6 cycloalkyl, optionally substituted by C1 to C4 alkyl, C1 to C4 alkoxy, C1 to C4 acyl and/or chlorine, bromine, C6 to C20 aryl, C6 to C20 aryloxy, C7 to C21 aroyl or C7 to C12 aralkyl,
R<14> -C1 to C4 alkyl, C1 to C4 alkoxy,
n=0 to 5,

R<15> , R<16> , R<17 > and R<18 > independently of one another C1-C30 alkyl, C5 to C6 cycloalkyl optionally substituted by C1 to C4 alkyl, and/or chlorine, bromine, C6 to C20 aryl or C7 to C12 aralkyl,
and wherein the radicals R<17 > and R<18 > can also be linked to a ring so that the nitrogen N shown in formula (VII) is part of a heterocyclic ring system,

R<19> -C1 to C30 alkoxy, C1 to C30 alkylthio, C1 to C30 dialkyamino, C5 to C6 cycloalkyl optionally substituted by C1 to C4 alkyl, and/or chlorine, bromine, wherein the C atoms of the ring can also be substituted by heteroatoms such as N, O or S.

11. A multi-layer product according to claim 10, wherein component G is one or more compounds selected from the group consisting of bis(2,4,6-trimethylbenzoyl)-phenyl phosphine oxide, (2,4,6-trimethylbenzoyl) diphenyl phosphine oxide, bis(2,6-dimethylbenzoyl)(2,4,4-trimethyl-pentyl) phosphine oxide, bis(2,6-dimethoxybenzoyl)(2,4,4-trimethyl-pentyl) phosphine oxide, benzoyl phosphonic acid bis(2,6-dimethylphenyl) ester, 2,4,6-trimethylbenzoylethoxyphenyl phosphine oxide, 2-benzyl-2-(dimethylamino)-1-(4-morpholinophenyl)-1-butanone and 2-methyl-1-[4-(methylthio)phenyl]-2-morpholino-1-propanone (see formula VIIa, wherein Me=methyl).
EMI21.0

12. A multi-layer product according to claim 1, wherein component G is selected from the group consisting of a) a mixture of bis(2,6-dimethoxy-benzoyl)(2,4,4-dimethylpentyl) phosphine oxide and (1-hydroxy-cyclohexyl)phenylmethanone and b) a mixture of bis(2,6-dimethoxy-benzoyl)(2,4,4-trimethylpentyl) phosphine oxide and 2-hydroxy-2-methyl-1-phenyl-1-propanone.

13. A multi-layer product according to claim 1, wherein the second layer comprises one or more compounds selected from the group consisting of polycarbonate, polyester carbonate, polyester, polyphenylene ethers and graft copolymers.
14. A multi-layer product according to claim 1 further comprising UV protective layer (S3) which contains a UV stabiliser according to formula (IV)
EMI22.0
wherein
X-OR<6> , OCH2CH2OR<6> , OCH2CH(OH)CH2OR<6 > or OCH(R<7> )COOR<8 >
R<6> =branched or unbranched C1-C13 alkyl, C2-C20 alkenyl, C6-C12 aryl or -CO-C1-C18 alkyl
R<7> -H or branched or unbranched C1 to C8 alkyl, and
R<8> -C1-C12 alkyl; C2-C12 alkenyl or C5-C6 cycloalkyl,
and wherein the layer sequence is (S1)-(S2)-(S3) and layers (S1) and (S3) have the same or different compositions.
15. A coating obtained from
A) one or more aliphatic polymer precursors selected from the group consisting of
A.1) aliphatic oligomers containing urethane bonds or ester bonds with at least two acrylate functions per molecule or mixtures of corresponding oligomers and
A.2) aliphatic reactive diluents with at least two acrylate groups per molecule or mixtures of corresponding reactive diluents,
B) one or more fine-particle inorganic compounds,
C) at least one organic UV absorber selected from the group consisting of triazine derivatives and biphenyltriazine derivatives,
D) optionally one or more radical scavengers of the hindered amine light stabilizer (HALS) class
E) optionally one or more flow control agents
F) optionally one or more solvents, and
G) at least one special photoinitiator selected from the group consisting of
H) cylphosphine oxide derivatives and [alpha]-aminoalkylphenone derivatives which is suitable for the production of at least one layer of a multi-layer product according to claim 1.
16. A process for the production of a multi-layer product according to claim 1, comprising
i) applying the first layer (S1) in the form of a coating formulation to the second layer (S2), and
ii) curing the coating formulation of the first layer by exposing the first layer to UV radiation.
17. A multi-layer product according to claim 1, wherein the second layer comprises a plastic molding.
